title: How to Make Ravioli with Broccoli Sauce

steps.headline: Cook broccoli in hot salted water until tender, strain the water.
Boil potatoes with their skin on, not peeling anything off.
Peel them afterwards from the boiling, and then finally, press them in bowl.
Heat 3 tablespoons oil with garlic (one clove) in a medium-sized saucepan until clove is colored, then turn off the heat and place the anchovies in the hot oil, waiting until they dissolve.
Add the boiled broccoli and cook the food, stirring for about only 5 to 6 minutes.
steps.description: Adjust as needed, due to different brands.

steps.headline: Let them cool, put in the potatoes, and finally the cheese and blend well.
Make a mound with the flour and form a depression in the middle.
Pour the eggs into the hole, and work the eggs and the flour together until you have a smooth dough.
Knead the dough for 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.description: Or, until firm. Avoid over-kneading as the ravioli may become tough.

steps.headline: Start to roll out dough using a rolling pin.
Cut out dough circles of about 8–10 centimeter (3.1–3.9 in) in diameter.
Put one tablespoon of filling at the center of each dough disc.
Fold the disc and press down on the sides to reinforce the borders.
Heat olive oil in a pan with another clove of garlic, add the broccoli tips and olives.
Add a small amount (2 to 3 spoonfuls) of boiling water and cook until the broccoli tips are just tender and soft.
Cook the ravioli in more boiling water, then strain and serve the meal with sauce.

text: Cook broccoli in hot salted water until tender, strain the water.  Boil potatoes with their skin on, not peeling anything off.  Peel them afterwards from the boiling, and then finally, press them in bowl.  Heat 3 tablespoons oil with garlic (one clove) in a medium-sized saucepan until clove is colored, then turn off the heat and place the anchovies in the hot oil, waiting until they dissolve.  Add the boiled broccoli and cook the food, stirring for about only 5 to 6 minutes. Adjust as needed, due to different brands. Let them cool, put in the potatoes, and finally the cheese and blend well.  Make a mound with the flour and form a depression in the middle.  Pour the eggs into the hole, and work the eggs and the flour together until you have a smooth dough.  Knead the dough for 10 to 15 minutes. Or, until firm. Avoid over-kneading as the ravioli may become tough. Start to roll out dough using a rolling pin.  Cut out dough circles of about 8–10 centimeter (3.1–3.9 in) in diameter.  Put one tablespoon of filling at the center of each dough disc.  Fold the disc and press down on the sides to reinforce the borders.  Heat olive oil in a pan with another clove of garlic, add the broccoli tips and olives.  Add a small amount (2 to 3 spoonfuls) of boiling water and cook until the broccoli tips are just tender and soft.  Cook the ravioli in more boiling water, then strain and serve the meal with sauce.  Sprinkle with some Parmesan cheese.  Enjoy your new delicious meal!
